events.question: What document would you like to read?

events.text: Huh.
It looks like a map of the nuclear plant.
The map shows various pumphouses, warehouses, towers, and generator buildings.
Looks like there's a note inside as well.
Let's see...
'Many of these locations are guarded and require permission and/or PINs to enter.'
Well, I definitely know we won't have permission.
These guards won't make it any easier to get into these places, but this map will at least let us know where we're going.
This is right up Alistair's lane and Julian's, too, now that I think about it.
Talk about a great find!
'Two-step verification and passcodes'?
*scoff*
W-What?
That's still a thing nowadays?
Lowen steps next to you to read the document.
'Various passcodes are necessary to enter many integral locations for security reasons.

'Thanks to Malia and Bernard's efforts, we were able to change the passcodes to all of the important locations so that whatever intruders that may force their way in can't do anything to the control systems for the plant.'
Good call on their part.
'The following codes are the new PINs and their respective locations:'
'Circulating Water Pumphouse and Electrical Buildings: 361173'
'Transformer Yard and Turbine Generator Building: 064043'
'Reactor Building and Radwaste and Control Building: 910204'
Huh.
What is it?
The last one has a star next to it.
Flip the paper over real quick.
You turn the paper over to see more written on the back.
'Two-step verification'...
'Due to the importance and danger of the reactor and control buildings if accessed by unauthorized personnel, a form of two-step verification have been implemented.'
'After inputting the correct PIN, a series of questions will be asked based on the PIN utilized.'
'The answers are the following in this order:'
'November 19, 2006'
'Denmark'
Uh...
The last answer isn't here.
The ink has been smudged somehow.
Dammit...
Finding Malia and Bernard should be first on the list if they were the ones to put all of this in place.
Better talk to Sayoko when we get the chance.
I'll keep that in mind.
*scoff*
'Fake Military Bozos' Background and Schedule'
Talk about a title.
'Here's what I've figured out about these so-called soldiers since they've come into town.
'Although they claim to be part of the United States Army, not only are they actually the National Guard, but their unit isn't even a real unit anymore!'
'After the Wings of Icarus incident the government had to reallocate funds to try and help the country that was way more than what the National Guard could do.'
'Some kind of investigation was done on the unit prior to and they were already on the chopping block, so it was bound to happen.'
'But their commander, Alvin Seegers had other plans for soldiers.'

'He had them steal weapons and ammo from their facilities and continue operating as if their unit was still activate on an indefinite humanitarian mission for the country despite government aid already being almost non-existent.'
'Tricking towns with small amounts of aid in the begining to gain their trust and claiming that they needed to stay for more resources to be sent for continued support from the government.'
'It worked, clearly.'
'Apparently, they've been running this scheme for a few months now, but with no one actually having anything to steal morale has been on the decline.'
'Not only are they, obviously, making more enemies with their tactics and losing troops, but they're running low on supplies and faith in their supposed leader suffering from power psychosis.'
'Those boys are tired as hell and sick of Seegers shit.'
'So maybe something can be done about that.'
'Anyway, on to actually important stuff: the security detail routine.'

'They have around six soldiers in total that circle various buildings at the top half of the plant, two at the plant entrance, four around the main water pumphouse, and finally two soldiers outside of the office their commander hides in.'
'They loop around in a counter clockwise pattern doing two complete rotation before moving clockwise for one rotation.'
'Normally, on the clockwise rotation the soldiers switch between areas to break up the monotony.'
'Around every hour, the commander leaves the office to do his walk to make sure his soldiers aren't sleeping which they do a lot and makes him go crazy.'
'You'll definitely hear his tanturm before you see him, so you'll probably want to stay away until it blows over.'
'However, the surveillance and intercom systems are in that office as well so take advantage of the situation accordingly.'
'These guys aren't anything crazy, but they still have guns, so best of luck to whoever reads this.'
Alvin Seegers...
I'm pretty sure I heard the shopkeeper saying similar stuff about this guy not being liked.
This defintely gives us a lot more insight on what we're up against and it sounds like we've got a couple of ways to deal with 'em.
We should run this by Alistair to get a better idea on what the next move should be here.
Will do.
If we handle this right, we might be able to help everyone at the end of the day.
